rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports findings using neutral language ('confirmed that its birds were infected').
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports a factual event (birds infected) but contains no explicit calming cues.
No minimiser or scale contrast found.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment reports a past event/fact, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports confirmation of infection, not primarily prices or numerical metrics.
The segment reports a past event, not speculation about future relief or improvement.
Attributed statement from Tyson Foods contains no framing language.
Factual report of confirmation/location without explicit framing cues.
